summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganDrench lips in this super glossy, high-shine balm that instantly melts onto skin, leaving behind a pigmented kiss of color. The about-face Cherry Pick Lip Color Butter is infused with a deliciously fruity scent and a blend of lip-loving ingredients.
details: DetailsFeaturesInfused with a deliciously fruity scent and a blend of lip-loving ingredients like pomegranate flower extract + cherry butter to plump and moisturize.Twist wisely! Once lip butter goes up, it won't come back down.BenefitsVegan and cleanly formulated.Item 2605929How To UseTwist wisely! Once lip butter goes up, it won't come back down.IngredientsDiisostearyl Malate, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Polybutene, Bis-Diglyceryl Polyacyladipate-2, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Microcrystalline Wax (Cera Microcristallina/Cire Microcristalline), Synthetic Wax, CI 17200 (Red 33 Lake), CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide), Stearalkonium Hectorite, Paraffin, Propylene Carbonate, Parfum (Fragrance), Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylene/Propylene Copolymer, CI 15850 (Red 7), Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter/Beurre de Karité), CI 15985 (Yellow 6 Lake), Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-di-t-butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Hexylene Glycol, CI 42090 (Blue 1 Lake), Punica Granatum (Pomegranate/Grenade) Flower Extract, Prunus Avium (Sweet Cherry/Guigne) Seed Oil, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate. V/081722
how_to_use: Twist wisely! Once lip butter goes up, it won't come back down.

reviews.headline: So Buttery
reviews.comments: This product is super pigmented and buttery smooth I would definitely recommend. A little goes a long way too which is nice.

reviews.headline: I wear this product nearly daily
reviews.comments: I love these so so much!! My holy grail lip product I reccommend to my friends and people like me who are specific about the texture of lip products. I have tried other lip glosses/color balms/color butters but I always seem to return them and come back to these haha. I have two of these clicky sticks now :).

reviews.headline: Vibrant pink
reviews.comments: I bought the dragonfruit, and I love this product. Yes it is a butter so it is not going to dry down and it is not matte, it smells lovely and the color is a magenta cool toned dark pink. I got this myself after getting the peach color one in a free online gift - that one I gave to my sister as it was more her color and she loved that one! So all in all I think it's a great item ! Don't put too much on or else it can smear a little bit , but one layer like a like balm is perfect amount !

reviews.headline: Great color and shine
reviews.comments: Shinier than Fenty gloss bomb. Plus the Cranberries color is what I wished Hot Choclit would have been. Cranberries is a touch warmer, browner whereas Hot Choclit is slightly more wine burgundy.

reviews.headline: My new Fav!!
reviews.comments:
smells great
hydrating
lasting color and I found a great pink color

reviews.headline: It's OK
reviews.comments: The consistency of this product might be better in a tube than a click stick. I cannot click this past the top of the applicator otherwise it gets all over the place. I love the smell, the color and the feel, but the application of this product is messy.

reviews.headline: Perfect if you like a lip oil
reviews.comments: I love a more messy/wearable makeup look so I'm obsessed with how the lip oil sinks into your lips and as you move it around it stains them the perfect lived in color. If you want precision this probably isn't for you, otherwise 10/10 recommend

reviews.headline: Beautiful and buildable color!
reviews.comments: I bought this in Ulta, I got the Watermelon  color. It's a beautiful color that is very buildable, and it leaves a nice stain on my lips after. My only con for this is that it dries my lips a little bit, but it's amazing overall.

reviews.headline: you're probably wearing this wrong!
reviews.comments: The marketing is a bit deceptive. It's super glossy and balmy but if anything this is best used as a lip tint. I apply it the same way I apply the MAC squirt plumping gloss where i dab it in the center of my lips and smudge/smear it across my lips, being careful not to go over my lip line (because it will blur out). I got it in cherry pick and wicked apple. it is absolutely sooo beautiful and has a great tint. Even after blotting and dabbing, the color stays. I have naturally dry skin and lips and it stays hydrated for a while!

reviews.headline: lip oil texture
reviews.comments: I couldn't get the hang of applying it. Very thin texture got on my teeth, migrated to my face, in my hair. just a mess. color good. tastes good but I wont by this one again.

reviews.headline: Perfect for layering
reviews.comments: I bought the color The Cranberries. Its so amazing its VERY pigmented and buildable. Very good for layering, taste's AMAZING(floral) its also long lasting. I like to use Topicals lip gloss and add the lip butter on top for some color.

reviews.headline: Application nightmare, might as well get  LIP GLOSS!!
reviews.comments:
LOVE THE COLOR LOVE THE SMELL Love the feel Idea needs to be worked on
Instantly melt on contact with lips makes it spreadable but pigment will be heavy on initial contact if lips are thick you will brush against the plastic chassis a cupid bow suck

reviews.headline: Love this lip gloss
reviews.comments: Smells great, looks good and lasts long.

reviews.headline: This color is amazing
reviews.comments: I absolutely love the way this is sheer but highly pigmented and buildable. This color has got the best purple undertone. Looks like when you bite your lip in winter.

reviews.headline: wanted to love
reviews.comments: i wanted to love this, i love a vampy dark lip, and the colour was great, but it cause my lips to chap and was so perfume forward that it was irritating. i have very sensitive skin, do no recommend if that's you. otherwise, application is a bit finicky, but not dissimilar to other products on the market like this.

reviews.headline: Love the color
reviews.comments: Beautiful color, can make shear or build, buttery, leaves a nice stain, smells good but little irritating on my lips.

reviews.headline: Pretty...
reviews.comments: I got the shade Pink Pina and it was okay. For Halsey I expected more, it looked like my other ones.

reviews.headline: So messy (shade: pink pina)
reviews.comments: When even very lightly applying this product, it glops everywhere and the smell is intense. There is almost not a good way to apply it unless you ise a lip brush which I dont have time for. It is not firm enough to be in the lipstick/balm form. It is like a hardened gloss or something that is totally unusable in my opinion. Even using my finger to dab it and apply smushes the actual "bullet" to oblivion. Rough first impression of the brand.

reviews.headline: love it
reviews.comments: I love it so much i got them in two colors. Might not work for everyone but i really like the formula. I just use a little and smudge it out for color.

reviews.headline: Good but messy
reviews.comments: I love the colors and feel of this product, and I love everything else from this brand. I placed an online order for these so unfortunately didn't look at the applicator, otherwise I probably would've avoided this product. The button applicator makes it so messy to apply, getting product on the sides like others have mentioned, and makes it hard to stay inside your liplines, even with a lip liner. I ended up using a brush to paint my lips with it instead of applying normally.

media.headline: So moisturizing and gorgeous!!!!
media.caption: Holding cherry pick lip color butter shades in pamplemousse, kiwi fuzz, and cherry good.

faceoff_positive.comments: I can't speak to any other colors, but the shade pamplemousse is a beautiful rosy pink that is close to my natural lip color. I love that it's so glossy/juicy yet super pigmented, especially for a balm. That said, it doesn't leave behind any kind of stain and is not particularly long lasting. That isn't a claim of the product, so I'm not mad about it, but I can't help but wonder how gracefully some of the more intense colors would wear off after eating or drinking. There is a strong fruity fragrance which I enjoy but others might not. The texture is…a little sticky, but not bad considering that it's both glossy AND full-coverage. I haven't tried other products of this type but from what I've seen that's to be expected. I'm not particularly adventurous with colors and a lot of them look quite warm-toned (I have a very cool complexion), but I would totally try kiwi fizz if it ever came back in stock! Peach punisher and the cranberries have my eye too!
faceoff_positive.headline: Pamplemousse is gorgeous!

faceoff_negative.comments: I was so excited to try these and got 4 shades - Kiwi Fuzz, Pamplemousse, Cherry Good, and Wicked Ape. I only got to swatch and sample two colors and have two to my friend. Despite my failed experience with the product, I will try to give a fair review.   Pros: 1. All the colors are pretty. My friend showed me her swatches and they were gorgeous too.  2. Lightweight and nice feel on the lips (before I got the allergic reaction). 3. Very moisturizing. 4. Good pigmentation.   Cons: 1. Super strong scent which might have caused the allergic reaction on my skin and lips. The swatch I did on my arm caused rashes (Kiwi Fuzz)  and my lips started stinging and swelled up (Wicked Apple). Unfortunately, the reaction was not immediate so I had already put it on my lips and then swatched on my arm for a few minutes before any reaction happened. My friend had no negative reactions, so everyone will react differently. 2. The click pen does not work as expected and you need way more than the recommended clicks to dispense the product. You need to keep an eye on how much product comes out so you won't get too much. 3. Dark colors were streaky and patchy despite putting them on moisturized and smooth lips. I swatched Wicked apple and it was difficult to get an even and smooth application. My friend said the same thing with her Cherry Good lipstick. She did not have the same issue with Pamplemousse.  4. Expensive for what it is. 5. No real staying power (obviously, since this is more like a lip balm than lipstick) and tends to bleed.   Overall, I am disappointed with the product as it did not live up to the hype.  I only returned the colors I had tested that caused an allergic reaction because I did not want the company to completely lose out since no one could have predicted that I would have an allergic reaction. I gave the unopened lipsticks to my friend and she said she likes the product but would not purchase it on her own.
faceoff_negative.headline: Disappointed coz it caused allergic reactions
